title: Ticket #7524: Python bindings negotiation flow causes segfault
description:
https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor-python-bindings-tutorials/issues/11 is an issue with the Python bindings negotiation mechanism: it can cause segfaults. The issue appears to be in the iterator over the resource requests you get from the negotiation session object.

Reproduction script is at https://github.com/htcondor/python-bindings-crashes/blob/master/tests/negotiation.py (reproduction tools are in that repository; clone it, run dr.sr or dr.cmd to get a Docker container with the right environment, then ./get_core_dump.sh python tests/negotiation.py to run the script under gdb).

Here's a core dump from running the example script:

#28 0x00007f2045c94505 in __libc_start_main (main=0x400640 <main>, argc=2, argv=0x7ffe47dff9e8, init=<optimized out>, fini=<optimized out>, rtld_fini=<optimized out>, stack_end=0x7ffe47dff9d8)
    at ../csu/libc-start.c:266
#29 0x000000000040066e in _start ()

It looks like the last place we have control is https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/blob/master/src/python-bindings/schedd.cpp#L368 

#3  0x00007f204463d9fd in getNextRequest (this=0x112ac30) at /usr/src/debug/condor-8.9.5/src/python-bindings/schedd.cpp:368
#4  RequestIterator::next (this=0x112ac30) at /usr/src/debug/condor-8.9.5/src/python-bindings/schedd.cpp:390

That block of code hasn't been changed since 2016, but it does acquire the module lock, which makes me think the recent module lock changes are what broke this.
remarks:
2020-Feb-26 16:02:02 by tannenba:
I tend to think of the bindings for negotiation and COD as experimental, and I am not aware of any existing (or planned) users. Not certain I want to commit to support these methods once 8.9 moves to a new stable series; we have other higher priority work to do. Thus my thinking is we should remove the negotiation and COD examples from the tutorials and documentation for now instead of spending development effort fixing/documenting them.

2020-Feb-27 09:01:29 by karpel:
Done. Will downgrade priority, but leave the ticket open for now.
check_ins:
2020-Jun-18 15:02   Check-in [59914]: (#7690) Also deprecate Schedd.negotiate(), as per gt#7524. (By Todd L Miller )
2020-Feb-27 08:58   Check-in [59060]: (#7524) do not display negotiation and COD methods in the Python bindings docs (By Josh Karpel )
creator: karpel
